Name: Provision of feminine hygiene products.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of feminine hygiene products

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: Int No. 1123-A was not signed at the Mayoral public hearing;  bill-signing ceremony subsequently scheduled for July 13, 2016.

History.Description: This Introduction was Bill Signing Scheduled by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: Bill signing ceremony scheduled to be held at the High School for Violin and Dance, 1110 Boston Road, Bronx, NY 10456.

History.Description: This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Summary: This bill would require that the Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS) provide a supply of feminine hygiene products to agencies operating or having oversight of providers operating temporary shelters sufficient to meet the needs of its residents. Temporary shelters means Department of Homeless Services family shelters and single adult women shelters, Department of Youth and Community Development shelters, and Human Resources Administration domestic violence shelters. The bill would also require DCAS to make available a supply of feminine hygiene products sufficient to meet the needs of youth in secure detention facilities operated by the Administration for Childrenâ€™s Services (ACS), as well as youth in congregate care facilities operated by ACS who are awaiting placement with a licensed foster care agency.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 2 of title 12 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 12-207 to read as follows:
      ï¿½ 12-207 Availability of feminine hygiene products. 
      a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings: 
      Feminine hygiene products. The term "feminine hygiene products" means tampons and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle. 
      Temporary shelters. The term "temporary shelters" means department of homeless services family with children shelters, adult family shelters, single adult women shelters and single adult men shelters; and human resources administration domestic violence shelters and HIV/AIDS services administration (HASA) shelters.
      b. The department of citywide administrative services shall make available to agencies operating or having oversight of providers operating temporary shelters a supply of feminine hygiene products sufficient to meet the needs of residents.  The department shall also make available a supply of feminine hygiene products sufficient to meet the needs of youth in secure detention facilities operated by the administration for children's services, as well as youth in congregate care facilities operated by the administration for children's services who are awaiting placement with a licensed foster care agency. 
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.
